```{r include = FALSE}
library(plotly)

y0 = 542
data_weak = read.table(paste0("C:/Users/Marcelo/Desktop/Covid/primeira_projs/estado-rio-weak-",as.character(y0),".csv"),sep = '\t', header = TRUE)
data_mod = read.table(paste0("C:/Users/Marcelo/Desktop/Covid/primeira_projs/estado-rio-moderate-",as.character(y0),".csv"),sep = '\t', header = TRUE)
data_strong = read.table(paste0("C:/Users/Marcelo/Desktop/Covid/primeira_projs/estado-rio-strong-",as.character(y0),".csv"),sep = '\t', header = TRUE)
d_weak = data_weak$intensive
d_mod = data_mod$intensive
d_strong = data_strong$intensive
dates = seq.Date(from = as.Date('2020-03-08'),to = as.Date('2020-06-08'), by = 1)
df_plot = data.frame(dates,d_weak,d_mod,d_strong)
fig <- plot_ly(df_plot, x = ~dates, y = ~d_weak, name = 'Controle Fraco', type = 'scatter', mode = 'lines') 
fig <- fig %>% add_trace(y = ~d_mod, name = 'Controle Moderado', mode = 'lines+markers') 
fig <- fig %>% add_trace(y = ~d_strong, name = 'Controle Forte', mode = 'lines+markers')
tit = paste0("Demanda por Leitos no Estado RJ (Infectados = ",as.character(y0)," no dia 08/03)")
fig <- fig %>% layout(title = tit,
                      xaxis = list(title = "Dias"),
                      yaxis = list (title = "Demanda por Leitos por COVID-19"))
fig
```
